title: Chrissy Teigen praises John Legend's sweet gesture: 'I haven’t been feeling like myself lately'
text:
CLOSE

Chrissy Teigen shares that John Legend took a flight to come see her for a few hours. (Photo: Rachel Murray, Getty Images for Netflix)

Swoon! John Legend changed his travel plans to come see Chrissy Teigen because she was having a rough day.

The "Lip Sync Battle" co-host raved about Legend's romantic gesture on Twitter on Sunday.

"I do not normally brag about john, as it is my schtick to make fun of him always, but he flew from London to LA instead of London to DC to have dinner with me and watch love island UK because I haven’t been feeling like myself lately," Teigen wrote. "Just a few hours but it meant a lot. Thank u."

She added that he also flew on his "least favorite airline" to make the trip happen.

Just a few hours but it meant a lot. Thank u — christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) October 27, 2019

Legend responded to Teigen's tweet saying he loved her and would see her tonight.

Fans responded to the model's tweet by praising her husband's thoughtfulness and sharing stories of their own partners doing something similar for them.

The two recently celebrated their sixth wedding anniversary and while their relationship is no doubt loving, it's also characterized by Teigen's quips at her husband.

She once humbled him about his ability to sing the national anthem after he tweeted about how he's one of the best at doing so.

"Settle down, you're ok at it," she wrote.

When Legend received a Grammy nomination for "All of Me," Teigen made sure to remind everyone that she was the inspiration for the song and should get a little recognition as well.

"2 grammy noms for @johnlegend no one has congratulated me for being the inspiration behind 'all of me' without me there is no all of me," she tweeted.

Teigen's witty remarks don't seem to bother Legend though, because he's cheering her on from the sidelines.

In their recent Vanity Fair cover interview, Legend recalls a time when he and former president Barack Obama joked about how their wives are more popular and loved than they are.

"I’m her biggest cheerleader," he says. "I always think she should do more."
